scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection contains manuscripts of his poem "Night in Venice" and "Unto each man comes a day".

In his correspondence he discusses Lincoln, his commitment to peace and Mary E. Surratt's guilt; an article he has written on Elmer Ephraim Ellsworth; the Southern Historical Society Papers and their low editorial standards; his book "Bread-winners" for which he allows an Italian translation; the proofs of his book "Abraham Lincoln"; a small printing of his collected poems and his giving up poetry writing; his election to the Kauai Kodak Klub; Alfred Austin's "A Tale of True Love and Other Poems"; and Charles Elliott's "The Book of American Interiors." He also requests an autograph copy of "Stonewall Jackson's Way"; declines to purchase photographs of Lincoln; regrets social invitations; thanks Thomas Nast for a cartoon of "The Emperor Roosevelt and the Rough Rider Wilhelm" and criticizes [Sophia M. B.?] Herrick's notes on Lincoln. Two portraits of Hay are included.
Correspondents include Mr. Alden, Robert Coster, Mr. Cunningham, Richard Watson Gilder, E. S. Goodhue, [J. R.?] Osgood, John Williamson Palmer, Mr. Taylor, Mr. House, and H. D. Traill.

did.unittitle: Manuscripts
Poem beginning "Unto each man comes a day . . ." n.d.
Poem: "Night in Venice" n.d.
Letters
John Hay to Mr. Taylor 1872 Jan 5

scopecontent.p: Expresses regret about "that engagement."

did.unittitle: J. H. to Mrs. Mack 1872 Jan 11

scopecontent.p: Regrets he could not respond to her invitation.

did.unittitle: J. H. to Cunningham 1876 Jun 20

scopecontent.p: Thanks him for letter and remembrance. Mentions he has quit writing poetry.

did.unittitle: J. H. to E. C. Hine 1881 Oct 6

scopecontent.p: Thanks for dinner invitation, but will not be able to attend.

did.unittitle: J. H. to Dr. J[ohn] W[illiamson]Palmer 1886 Aug 17

scopecontent.p: Asks for autograph copy of "Stonewall Jackson's Way," if J. W. P. is the author of it.

did.unittitle: J. H. to Dr. J. W. Palmer 1886 Aug 24

scopecontent.p: Thanks J. W. P. for granting request; discusses "Southern Historical Society Papers." Adivses against buying the series because poorly edited.

did.unittitle: J. H. to Richard Watson Gilder [1886 Nov 24]

scopecontent.p: Sends corrected proofs for Abraham Lincoln. Suggests subtitle "Lincoln in Congress." Thanks donor of Lincoln autograph.

did.unittitle: J. H. to House [1890] Jan 16

scopecontent.p: Wrote article on Ellsworth under pressure and has no feeling for it. Would like to write more on Ellsworth.

did.unittitle: "The Author" [J. H.] to Mr [J. W.] Harper 1890 Jan 22

scopecontent.p: Asks if Bread-winnershas earned anything. Requests half a dozen copies be sent him in Washington. W/AN 1890 Jan 22 J. W. Harper to W. Muller, to fill above order.

did.unittitle: J. H. to Mr. [J. W. ?] Harper 1890 Mar 8

scopecontent.p: Regrets cannot accept invitation because of previous engagment. Sends regards to William Dean Howells.

did.unittitle: J. H. to Richard Watson Gilder 1894 Nov 23

scopecontent.p: Indicates corrections for sonnet he submitted to R. W. G. Asks for proofs of same when printed.

did.unittitle: J. H. to Samuel Sidney McClure 1895 Oct 31

scopecontent.p: Requests a proof of the Ellsworth article before it is printed.

did.unittitle: J. H. to "Dear Sir" 1897 Jul 19

scopecontent.p: Has no objection to translation of Bread-winnersinto Italian, but will not put his name to the book.

did.unittitle: H. D. Traill to J. H. 1898 Aug 22

scopecontent.p: Accepts poem by Mr. [J. W. ?] Palmer for Literature(his London magazine).

did.unittitle: J. H. to Mr. Palmer 1898 Aug 25

scopecontent.p: Has sent P.'s poem to editor of Literature.

did.unittitle: J. H. to E. S. Goodhue 1901 Apr 29

scopecontent.p: Thanks for election as honorary member of the Kauai Kodak Klub. Signature probably not in J. H.'s hand.

did.unittitle: J. H. to Harper & Brothers 1902 Apr 17

scopecontent.p: Thanks for letter and copy of Alfred Austin's work, A Tale of True Love and Other Poems.

did.unittitle: J. H. to Robert Coster 1903 Jan 27

scopecontent.p: Will sign the photograph if sent to him.

did.unittitle: J. H. to R. C. 1903 Jan 30

scopecontent.p: Returns photograph, signed.

did.unittitle: J. H. to R. C. 1903 Apr 29

scopecontent.p: Returns photograph of President Lincoln; obliged for offer, but does not care to purchase it.

did.unittitle: J. H. to R. C. 1903 Nov 17

scopecontent.p: Returns miniture portrait of Lincoln. He is not collecting such things; refers him to Mr. Lambert of Philadelphia.

did.unittitle: J. H. Dr. J. W. Palmer 1903 Dec 7

scopecontent.p: Has received enclosed poem, "Braddock." Sends copy congratulations; his verses are a sign of youth.

did.unittitle: J. H. to Mr. Osgood n.y. Feb 14

scopecontent.p: Asks for another copy of The Book of American Interiors; has promised one to a friend.

did.unittitle: J. H. to Richard Watson Gilder n.y. Mar 7

scopecontent.p: Denies stories critical of Lincoln. Insists on Lincoln's commitment to peace and union.

did.unittitle: J. H. to Mr. Alden n.y. Jun 30

scopecontent.p: Encloses a sonnet made for Alden.

did.unittitle: J. H. to Richard Watson Gilder n.y. Oct 29

scopecontent.p: Discusses extent of Mrs. Surratt's guilt in the Lincoln assassination.

did.unittitle: J. H. to Miss King n.y. Dec 11

scopecontent.p: Thanks for letter and photograph of his aunt Evelyn. Sends copy of all his verses; only a few copies have been printed, none of which are for sale.

did.unittitle: J. H. to Richard Watson Gilder n.d.

scopecontent.p: Returns [Sophia M'Ilvaine Bledsoe ?] Herrick's notes re Lincoln. Questions her accuracy, and criticizes her memory of issues. Concludes that even intelligent women are careless.
